content.description:
Starts on 2 parallel cracks beside a huge tree. A few tricky moves lead to a ledge with a corner in the back. Climb the corner pass a tree (don't be be scarred to grab the tree) gaining a short slab section with a awesome overhanging corner in the back. The final move is pretty wild ending on a huge ledge.

Far left side of the wall.  Behind a huge evergreen tree.
Standard rack

climbs.name: Bird on a Wire
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Josh Shewbridge, Greg Hughes

content.description:
This is a face climb of sorts with a bit of sparse gear. this climb starts under the roof at Powdered Greens after clipping a piton under the roof the climb traverses left to some great ledges. Head straight up passing a few for ledges to the Linghall ledge or continue up the corner of Lilly.

this climb starts under a small roof just left of a obvious hand crack.
Gear is tricky on this climb, don't pass up on the opportunity to place it when you can. standard rack to 1"

Climb Iron Fist(recommended) or Powder Greens. From the ledge, continue pretty much straight up blocky rock to a mature tree (optional belay here). From the tree, climb an easy corner to another ledge. Place some small gear and make committing moves past a sloper to get established in the overhanging corner*. Top out on a ledge. Walk right about 5m to a notch where easy ledgy climbing takes you to a final short diagonal crack and top out. Tree anchor.
*For reference, this corner is to the right of the corner for Lost but Never Forgotten.

Shares a start with Powder Greens or Iron Fist
Standard rack, some Alpine draws, be sure to bring small stuff (.1 and .2 X4's were used on the FA)

climbs.name: Colorado Cowboy
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Cory Hall, Dan Morton

content.description:
Follow a blank section up in to an alcove with a horn in it, sling the horn and make a short move to a little birch tree. Follow the widening crack straight up to a larger ledge with a corner in the back. Climb the 10ft corner crack crux to the LingHall Ledge.

This climb is located on the left side of the main theater beside a very large spruce or fur. There is a slight trail that will lead to a rock ledge, start by the tree.
There is a piece before the corner with the horn in it. You can sling the horn if your tall and if your short you can lasso the horn. The rest of the climb take good gear and bring a #4 cam for the widening crack 20 feet up

Climbing the left trending hand crack through a series of flakes to the large ledge, awkward climbing with great protection makes this route unique in nature. 

Starts just left of Hall It Out.
Standard rack

climbs.name: The Good, The Trad and The Ugly

content.description:
Start at the base of an overhanging corner. The climbing is very technical and requires small gear that's tricky to place. After pulling the final lip some easy climbing over ledges brings you to a huge ledge with an anchor.

Left and around the corner from "hall it out"
Standard rack to 2 inch. Small offset nuts will help.

climbs.name: The Green Team
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Brittany Gionet, Josh Shewbridge

content.description:
You can only access this route by first climbing Iron Fist or Powder Greens. These routes originally embed on a birch tree, the tree is no longer there so you'll have to finish on this route.   
 Starts on the ledge 25 feet up and follows the corner up to a large ledge.

Starts on the ledge where Iron Fist and Powder Greens finish.
Standard rack

climbs.name: Gringo's Last Stand
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Cory Hall, Dan Morton

content.description:
Start from the large tree with the rock ledge in front of it. This climb follows the obvious left to right slanting crack (12) up to the corner. Climb the corner for the remaining 50 feet finishing with an awesome corner crack.

This climb is located on the left side of the main theater beside a very large spruce or fur. There is a slight trail that will lead to a rock ledge, start by the tree.
Bring a Rack, and maybe a few extra  small cam.

Starts on a small flake and a tough hard to protect boulder problem leads into an amazing finger crack in a corner. The corner ends at a jug filed roof and one final crux brings you to a perfect flake the stops at a 2 bolt anchor. Located on a rocky ledge, at the right side of the left wall. Stander rack to 1''.
Might want extra finger size cams.
2 bolt anchor

climbs.name: Mammas Don't Let Your Babies Grow Up to Be Sport Climbers
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Sam Jones, Josh Shewbridge

content.description:
This is a really nice climb with the crux about 10 feet off the ground. After pulling the well protected crux the next 25 feet is easier face climbing with absoltly no protection and if you fall you better hope your belayer can run faster than gravity.

this climb is located just left of Gringos Last Stand.
single rack to 1"

Pleasant movement on nice rock but the protection rating is R. There is gear but it is not great and the fall would be ugly. 


Located in the upper corner 10 feet right of Yin.  Start between a detached block and a big slab.  Follow the natural line on the right side of the corner (just right of Yin) and top out on a low angle slab.  Rap the route.
Standard rack to 3". Two pins. Tree anchor.

Lots of variety and cool features here.

Located in the upper corner just right of Hall It Out with the same start.  Climb up a couple of blocks to a series of V shaped corners that continue all the way to the top. There is a harder variation that moves slighter left near the top. It is the yellow line on the topo. Rap the route.
Single rack to 1". Two pins.  Tree anchor.
Any climbs that start from ground level, and not on a higher ledge.
